instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related headf*ck. Blue tint when using intel HD gpu
threads.message:
I had a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had its gpu done in 2015/16 (216-0809000)
This was done by apple, it quit on me and i fitted a new chip. 

It looks fine on the boot screen until the driver loads and then it goes blue,
at first i thought id got a bad chipset sold to me, so i fitted another, and it has the same issue.

Oddly enough if i turn of graphics switching the colour profile goes back to normal. Basically the Intel HD3000 isn't working properly. 

I replaced the GMUX suspecting that to be the cause, but nope, it didnt resolve anything. Im starting to think it could be a cold joint under the PCH or something. But its really messing with my head. 
Anyone seen this before?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related headf*ck. Blue tint when using intel HD gpu
threads.message: Measure all termination resistors <RESISTOR>R9650</RESISTOR>-56. Compare diode mode readings between the LVDS channels. Only thing left is bad solder on PCH/broken trace after that.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related headf*ck. Blue tint when using intel HD gpu
threads.message: I've seen this. I took a risk and reflowed the whole board in my reflow oven at a high temp. (dont do this ppl) I was out of options. Board worked !!  Its been gone for 7 weeks now.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related headf*ck. Blue tint when using intel HD gpu
threads.message: You cannot reflow a whole board like that. If it really got to the point of melting the solder the board would have been totally fucked. Also without flux it would be pointless.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU related headf*ck. Blue tint when using intel HD gpu
threads.message:
Was <RESISTOR>R9656</RESISTOR>, measured 5.3kOhm instead of 100ohm. Thanks duke. Youre a star, i would have been chasing that for a long time.

Im still madly confused as to how it went bad, no liquid on this board.ect. overall pretty happy though! :)
